nodes.description: 1983年10月23日，241名美军人员在贝鲁特和平keeping任务中遭自杀式爆炸袭击，造成重大伤亡
nodes.support_text: October 23, 1983 at approximately 6:20 a.m., 241 Marines, sailors and soldiers were killed, and hundreds of others were wounded or disabled.

nodes.description: 1993年9月14日，退伍军人Chuck Hall等人携2万签名向美国邮政总局提交邮票发行请求
nodes.support_text: 1993年9月14日，Hall等人携2万签名到华盛顿提交请求

nodes.description: 2003年1月31日，国会通过H. Res. 45决议支持发行贝鲁特纪念邮票，但需50名联名议员未达成
nodes.support_text: It remains in a congressional committee, said Lanier Swann, a Jones spokeswoman. "They haven't given it serious consideration and right now it's at a standstill in committee."

nodes.description: 2003年10月23日，美国邮政在杰克逊维尔邮局实施特别纪念邮戳日，但被退伍军人认为象征性不足
nodes.support_text: It's a nice gesture, but it falls short, Hall said. "It's a slap in the face of our comrades."

nodes.description: 2003年10月20日，《杰克逊维尔每日新闻》报道邮政总局持续拒绝贝鲁特纪念邮票请求
nodes.support_text: October 20,2003 ERIC STEINKOPFF JACKSONVILLE DAILY NEWS STAFF After almost 20 years and despite more than 20,000 signatures in hand, the U.S. Postal Service is still denying requests for a stamp honoring troops killed in the 1983 terrorist bombing in Beirut.

nodes.description: 2003年1月，Chuck Hall与北卡罗来纳州议员Walter B. Jones会面推动国会立法
nodes.support_text: Last year Hall traveled to Washington, D.C. and met with U.S. Rep. Walter B. Jones, R-N.C., who put congressional action in motion to support the move for a stamp.

nodes.description: 1993年邮政总局公民邮票咨询委员会以'缺乏历史意义'为由拒绝贝鲁特邮票提案
nodes.support_text: Some of the comments made at that time for denying the request were 'We try to honor positive things.' 'People want pretty non-controversial stamps.' 'Beirut lacked significance in American history and not enough people were killed.'

nodes.description: 2003年10月20日，Charles Hall通过《读者文摘》致信呼吁关注贝鲁特纪念邮票缺失问题
